active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the most critical remote work security challenge (e.g., unsecured home Wi-Fi vs. phishing) in the post-pandemic era. Support your position with statistics (e.g., 20% increase in phishing attacks per Verizon DBIR) and propose one mitigation strategy. How does this challenge impact organizational risk?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Remote Work Security Challenges' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Awareness and Training > Threat Awareness and Prevention > Network and Communication Threats > Remote Work Security Challenges). Use university-level pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding. Voter priorities: Ensure completeness with full challenges (unsecured home Wi-Fi, VPN issues, BYOD, shadow IT, insider threats, phishing, malware), best practices (VPN, MFA, EDR), standards (NIST SP 800-46, ISO 27001), statistics (e.g., Verizon DBIR: 81% breaches via credentials), and sources. Completed Research Context: Remote work expands attack surface via distributed endpoints. Key Challenges: 1) Unsecured Wi-Fi (eavesdropping); 2) Phishing (increased susceptibility); 3) BYOD (unmanaged devices); 4) Shadow IT (unsanctioned tools); 5) VPN misconfigs; 6) Insider threats. Best Practices: Zero-trust, MFA, endpoint protection. Standards: NIST, CIS. Sources: NIST.gov/SP800-46, Verizon DBIR 2023, CISecurity.org, ISO.org/27001, CrowdStrike 2023 Threat Report. Learning Objectives: [Insert the 6 objectives from above]. Scaffolding Layers: [Insert the 4 layers from above]. Active Learning: Incorporate elements into explanations (e.g., 'Discuss in groups: ...'). Generate 40 flashcards (10 per layer, balanced types: 25% recall, 40% MCQ, 20% apply, 15% analyze/eval). Follow Flashcard Schema exactly: Question/Answer structure, distractor protocol, explanations with rationale/source. Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'layer': 1, 'bloom_level': 'Remember', 'objective_link': 1}, ...]. Ensure measurable, engaging, web-grounded content.
